heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 06 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (178°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 620 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 760 m) and feels like temperature (up 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 620.2m lower than yesterday, 50.6m higher than the past week, 759.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 737m and a high of 4780m, averaging 1773.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
